client
Class TwitterClient

java.lang.Object
  client.TwitterClient

public final class TwitterClient
extends java.lang.Object

Uses the Twitter API to create a client to communicate with the Twitter web service, gather information about users, and return TwitterUser instances containing the information most useful for similarity computations.

Requires a valid Twitter user name and password to be instantiated.

Author:
sh

                     java.lang.String password)

Constructs a Twitter API instance.

Parameters:
username - a valid user name registered with twitter.com
password - password for the given user name
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if something went wrong, most likely because the login name or password was wrong.
Method Detail

createUser

public TwitterUser createUser(java.lang.String userName)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
Collects information for a user given a login name.

Parameters:
userName -
Returns:
wrapper containing a selection of the information available about a user
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if a user with the given login name does not exist or something else went wrong either on the client side (unauthorized request, overstaying one's welcome) or the server (twitter.com) side.

getTrends

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTrends()
Returns the 10 most discussed topics on Twitter at the time of the call.

Returns:
a list of topics

getPublicTimeLine

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPublicTimeLine()
Returns:
the 20 most recent tweets from non-protected users
